character.name: Gaius Ursus Maximus
character.brief_description: Military officer and unit leader under Corvus. The most physically imposing of the four — heavily muscular, aggressive, built for combat. Restless in garrison work; seeks the fight that will define his reputation. The curse transforms him into the Third Horseman.
character.full_description: Maximus is a military officer known for exceptional physical strength and combat mastery. Born in Rome, raised in military garrison towns after his father's death at eleven — strength became the only reliable currency. He leads through presence and dominance, preferring direct action over strategic planning. Under Corvus' command, he seeks approval more obviously than from Brutus; the relationship has a quality of mentorship — Corvus teaching strategy, Maximus implementing with enthusiasm. During the crucifixion, he executes with physical efficiency, categorizing Malchus' discomfort as weakness. His participation triggers a supernatural curse that freezes him at age 30 and transforms him into the Third Horseman — ungoverned aggression without strategic direction. The body that was his tool becomes his prison.
character.occupation: Military officer, leader of a unit under Corvus
character.opening_state: Confident young officer; physically at peak; respected for strength; ambitious for advancement
character.key_transformation: Cursed during crucifixion; frozen at age 30; transformed into instrument of endless violence
character.closing_state: Trapped in curse; compulsive violence; autonomous aggression; serves purposes beyond understanding
character.arc_preview: From confident officer commanding execution detail, through supernatural curse triggered by participation in crucifixion, to trapped instrument of endless violence serving purposes beyond his control
